head.supplied: Melbourne botanic Garden. ¶ 25.7.70. ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of two glass cases with 29 growing NZ plants, which you have been so good to forward to the bot. Garden of ...

div.p: OP/7/53/9967/12 general inwards letters, Superintendent, Otago Provincial Government, National Archives of New Zealand, Wellington.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of two glass cases with 29 growing NZ plants, which you have been so good to forward to the bot. Garden of Melbourne and for which as well as for the 13 kinds of New Zealand seeds I beg to tender my best thanks.

I now return the two cases filled with 59 industrial plants, shipped by the "Gothenburg" to your adress and I beg also to forward a good sized packet of seeds of the valuable Carob-tree or St Johns Bread-tree (Ceratonia Siligna) which ought to thrive well in the vallies of New Zealand and yield in abundance its valuable fruit.

I would have effected this sending earlier in the season, but all my glass cases were abroad and none came in for packing the consignment intended for you. All the plants are pot grown and will therefore be in good time for being now planted out. It is scarcely necessary to remark, that these valuable plants should be planted into rich soil of sheltered humid vallies and not on bleak exposed cold barren places

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,

The honorable the Superintendent of Otago
MS annotation by [unknown]: 'I have kept the receipt R'.
